info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 2:04AM PDT until August 21 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN LINCOLN, SOUTHERN NYE AND NORTHWESTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 204 AM PDT, Heavy rainfall continues across the Amargosa Desert and Pahrump Valley with hourly rain rates of a tenth to a quarter of an inch per hour. Area washes are running at a high volume and local roadways are experiencing flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pahrump, Mercury, Beatty, Spring Mountains, Lathrop Wells, Amargosa Valley, Indian Springs, Willow Creek Campground, Lovell Canyon Campground, Mountain Springs and Mt. Potosi. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
